tags.name: Accounts
tags.description:
The Accounts API is responsible for providing callers with information pertaining to a customer's accounts.
The first of the end-points that is being made available is for the accounts collection. The initial goal of this end-point is to provide the caller (e.g. a merchant's web site) to list a client's accounts and balances as a part of the checkout and payment flow.

tags.name: Charges
tags.description:
To collect a payment for a good or service we first need to create a charge. A charge verifies that a given account has enough funds (the available balance) to pay for a purchase. If there are enough funds in an account the charge amount is placed in an authorised state for the funds to be captured by the merchant after the purchase has been fulfilled.
For convenience, the charge API allows the caller to both authorise and capture in a single request. This is to support situations where the goods being purchased are made available at the time the charge is created.
Charges may remain in an authorised state, and the funds placed on hold, for a limited period of time. The timeframe is dependent upon your merchant agreement.
From time to time it may be necessary to cancel a charge before the funds have been captured. For example, when a customer cancels an order prior to shipping. As no funds have been transferred out of the customer's account, the charge is marked as cancelled and the hold on funds is removed.
In the event that a charge has been captured, it is possible to refund an amount to the customer's account. The amount of a refund can be the same, more, or less than the amount of the captured amount.

tags.name: Checkouts
tags.description: The Checkouts API allows a system to register detailed SKU-level information about what is being purchased. This is optional in the payment flow.

tags.name: Healthcheck
tags.description: The Status API is here to notify the status of Linking and Charges services.

tags.name: Identity
tags.description:
The Identity API is responsible for generating OAuth tokens.
The [token] endpoint can generate different kinds of tokens based on the value of the [grant_type] parameter. To generate a new access token, id token, and refresh token for a user, the recommended value for parameter [grant_type] is [refresh_token].

tags.name: Linking
tags.description:
The Linking API is responsible for identifying the customer and to retrieve a token that represents the customer.
The first of the end-points that is being made available is for the customer identification. The initial goal of this end-point is to provide the caller (e.g. a merchant's web site) to a way to verify an phone number associated with an customer.

tags.name: System
tags.description: The primary role of services made available under the System namespace are to provide information on the current state of the system. The first of these services to be published is a health check endpoint that provides a status for each of our public APIs

post.description:
A charge is created by issueing a POST request to the /charges collection. For the charge to be authorised the request must be approved by the customer. To allow merchants to make the checkout process more frictionless, it is possible to provide an access_token for the customer accounts as a part of the request. The access_token is to be provided in the Authorization header in the HTTPS request.

Calls to create a Charge may supply a reference number that is specific to the merchant as a way to reconcile charges across systems.

parameters.name: Idempotency-Key
parameters.description: When same operation is tried again, if you pass the Idempotency-Key we map to the same transaction to avoid duplicate

amount.description: Amount of this charge. This is the amount that will be transferred (if capture=true) from customer to merchant account or ring-fenced if capture=false. The value is provided as a string containing a numeric value in a format that is appropriate for the provided currency code. (eg; "100.00" or "100" when capturing an amount in "aud")

capture.description: Whether to immediately capture the charge. When 'false', the charge issues an authorization (or pre-authorization) that will need to be captured later. Uncaptured charges may be expired depending on your merchant agreement.

currency.description: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Only "aud" is supported at present.

description.description: An arbitrary string which you can attach to a 'Charge' this will appear in the user's Account Activity. A clear charge description helps reduce customer confusion about why they have been charged.
description.example: a pair of shoes at Easter Gardens

metadata.description: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format that is available when retrieving the charge later.

checkout_id.description: The checkout id. Checkout is optional in the payment flow.

merchant_id.description: The Zip merchant_id that the funds should be settled against.

account_id.description: The customer's account_id that the funds should be charged against.

reference.description: The caller can specify a unique identifier for the charge to reconcile the charge against their own systems.

status.description: If the charge was created without capturing, this enum represents whether it is still uncaptured or has since been captured.

created.description: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

_links.description: References to self and other resources

href.description: A URL that links to the current resources
The URL to capture the current charge (only available if the status is "authorised").
The URL to cancel the current charge (only available if the status is "authorised")
